title: Draped Torso of Woman
medium: terracotta, misfired. Pale brown and friable.
description:
Tanagra type fragment of either grave offering or votive. Hollow and from bivalve mold, with central part of unmodeled back cut out to form originally square, but now damaged vent.

Though piece was purportedly found on island of Capri, fragment's resemblance to headless Hellenistic terracotta figurine from Paestum shrine justifies broader attribution (Campania, southern Italy).
inscriptions: on verso in paint: SG-R/ No.16
